Planning and Special Programs (PSP)
Table of Contents
) Purpose: This IRM section describes unique characteristics of international returns. and (
) Audience: The primary users of this IRM are Planning and Specialty (PSP) employees. (
) Policy Owner: Director, Withholding and International Individual Compliance (WIIC) (
) Program Owner: WIIC is responsible for administering this program. (

) Program Goals: The goals of the PSP area align with the LB&I Strategic to apply the tax laws with integrity and fairness through a highly skilled and satisﬁed workforce, in an environment of inclusion where each employee make a maximum contribution to the mission of the team. (

) PSP is responsible for classiﬁcation and assignment of cases of U.S. living or working abroad in a U.S. Territory, U.S. Territory residents with U.S.- sourced income and/or U.S. federal income tax withheld, U.S. citizens or resident aliens who hold income producing assets in a foreign country or the foreign earned income exclusion or foreign tax credit, and permanent residents and non-resident aliens who have a U.S. ﬁling requirement. This includes reporting and payment requirements under Chapter
(Withholding Tax on Nonresident Aliens and Foreign Corporations) and Chapter

(Taxes Enforce Reporting on Certain Foreign Accounts) of the Internal Revenue This also includes determining amounts to be transferred between the U.S. Treasury and the U.S. Territory treasuries, related to IRC

) PSP area is comprised of four program areas, each with different goals and responsibilities, as follows: a. WIIC Support b. WIIC Classiﬁcation c. WIIC Identiﬁcation d. Campaign and Voluntary Disclosure Support (
) The development, implementation and oversight of PSP procedures are the prerogative of the Director, WIIC. (

) PSP employees and managers should be familiar with and use the examina- tion procedures and information contained in this IRM and also be aware of the applicable procedures in other examination IRM chapters, as cited or linked. (

) Program Reports: Director, WIIC Practice Area prepares periodic brieﬁng reports for the LB&I commissioner focusing on: a. Signiﬁcant accomplishments and opportunities for improvement b. Changes in procedures that have been implemented c. Operational, technical, and staffing updates d. Any other key information (
) Internal Revenue Manual

4.1 Planning and Special Programs
The following is a list of frequently used acronyms in this program:

Acronym Term CNMI Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands DIF Discriminant Function LB&I Large Business and International OVDP Offshore Voluntary Disclosure Program POD Post of Duty PSP Planning and Specialty Programs RA Revenue Agent TCO Tax Compliance Officer TE Tax Examiner USVI U.S. Virgin Islands WIIC Withholding and International Individual Compliance
Withholding and International Individual Compliance
) The Chief, Classiﬁcation Section is responsible for ensuring all returns with international characteristics are classiﬁed at the campus before sending to the areas. (
) All returns with international characteristics will be classiﬁed by international issue teams. (

) Individuals responsible for the classiﬁcation of returns will do the following: a. Identify returns they select for possible examination or those they will associate with returns already under examination as “international.” b. Ensure the Form

, Document Transmittal, sent to the area and Special Programs (PSP) territory manager states the returns were selected for “international,” and includes special instructions for that should be associated with the related return of another area or a return that is part of a national or area coordinated examination.

Procedures, instructions, and information for the identiﬁcation and selection of returns are applicable to LB&I returns except as provided in the following sub-
The mathematical discriminant function (DIF) formulas for individual returns are not generally applicable to international returns identiﬁed for LB&I.
The individual returns Post-of-Duty (POD) Report 1040–1 is generated for LB&I WIIC using post-of-duty assigned by country or countries.
Separate PODs are used for APO/FPO returns. All Form
-NR are assigned to LB&I WIIC and POD
Various PODs within LB&I WIIC will be assigned Form
-PR and Form
-SS. POD
will be assigned to LB&I WIIC returns which are not covered by a valid POD code.
4.1.9.5.4 (11-21-2019) Ordering Returns
Form 1040-NR, Form 1040-PR, or Form 1040-SS may be separately ordered for LB&I WIIC by placing a POD supplemental order for individual returns.
Tax examiners from LB&I WIIC PSP will classify the following returns:
